misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception / correct conditional range mapping
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that letter grades can be determined by checking thresholds from highest to lowest (>=90, >=80, ...), assigning a single char, then printing it.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No conceptual gap detected. In Java, an if/else-if chain is evaluated top-down and the first true condition executes; this correctly implements mutually exclusive grade ranges when ordered from highest to lowest.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct letter grade output for inputs in 0–100.

misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No substantive misconception detected (correct conditional range mapping)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that an if/else-if chain should be used to test grade thresholds from highest to lowest, assigning a single letter grade based on the first matching condition.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap: in Java, an if/else-if chain evaluates conditions in order and executes exactly one matching branch. Checking thresholds in descending order correctly implements the specified ranges (90+, 80+, 70+, 60+, else).
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output for all integers 0–100 (and also behaves sensibly for out-of-range values, though validation was not required).
